page.title: 14Health
page.content: There is no doctor or dentist in the area. Most people travel to Bromyard to surgeries there. People needing hospital treatment are referred to hospitals in Hereford, Worcester, or Malvern. Bromyard hospital is for geriatics, though it also has an outpatients physiotherapy department, well used by local people. Some elderly residents are collected twice a week by ambulance and taken to the Day Hospital in Bromyard. Here they may receive physiotherapy, baths, hairdressing, lunch, and an opportunity to meet other people which they might not otherwise have. People may be visited in their homes by a community nurse, and domiciliary occupational and physio therapists. Home helps are provided for the sick and elderly. Expectant mothers attend ante-natal clinics in Bromyard.
